text.p: -- Schroder Wertheim analysts Michael Mayer and Philip Tendler raised refiner Tosco Corp to outperform from market performer based on price.
-- Tosco was trading up 1/4 in morning trade at 29 and Schroder has a target price of 33 for the stock.

-- "Shares of Tosco have sold off $3.00 per share in the last two days in response to estimate reductions. The stock is now 15 percent below our target price, and appears to be discounting a refining margin environment which is well below our view of sustainable refining margins," the analysts said.

-- Schroder said that West Coast refining margins have been in the lower third of their five year range for the past six weeks and it expects second quarter margins to average $6.50 per barrel, down from $8.20 in the last quarter and $9.65 a barrel a year ago. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
